storyInfo: The children bring over their bedding, soft and warm. Let's tuck him in, they say. The nice man'll get a cold sleeping here.

attributes.text: We should have something to look forward to in life.
It's a funny thing to say out loud. Isn't it granted, after all?
If we don't expect the slightest thing out of life, then why are we endowed with life, and born unto this world, anyway? It can't be just to suffer, can it?
You see, children don't think about such strange questions.
Oh, childhood, how carefree were your days. Only when we've left it behind, can we then appreciate its worth.
For our adolescence, and for our prime, the same thing goes. Filled with worries moment to moment—yet in time, you look back, and wonder to yourself what those little worries even meant.
Back then, we had strength we could never use up. We always wanted to do something or other—we always believed life would get better.
And so we were earnest. And so we strove to live.
How strange. Wasn't everything meant to get better?
It's hard to say at what point it happened, but it was like I'd lost the vigor to long for the future.
Narrower grew the spaces that could accommodate me. Thinner grew the air that could give me breath. Now my life was heavy, and I could see the end of it, and it... had hope no more.
As if a stone rolling down a mountain.
And you can see, and I can see, it's not ever going to stop. It'll just fall, and fall, and fall.

attributes.content: My flowers... they're all gone.
attributes.name: Clément

attributes.content: Do not step forward.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: This part of the building has suffered repeated structural damage. It has a high degree of instability...
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Urgh—!
attributes.name: Clément

attributes.content: Clément, come back.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: No, Senior Federico... I need... to look one more time.
attributes.name: Clément

attributes.content: You previously stated that the flower you are looking for is not here.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: I did, I just wanted to check... all the flowers are dead. And not one... not a single one... had the luck to be saved.
attributes.name: Clément

attributes.content: Ahh... ha... hah...
attributes.name: Clément

attributes.content: I am unable to analyze your behavior.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: I am unable...
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: I planted these flowers myself... to stand for friendship and hope.
attributes.name: Clément

attributes.content: But they stopped caring about those things long ago. Nobody follows the flowering seasons anymore. They forgot the one thing above all they shouldn't forget.
attributes.name: Clément

attributes.content: Isn't it ridiculous? How some could suspect Raimund of the fire, just because he's a Sarkaz?
attributes.name: Clément

attributes.content: After living beside each other for so long. The harder the times, the closer we should come together... so His Excellency says. I want like nothing else to believe him... and by all rights, I should.
attributes.name: Clément

attributes.content: But the truth is placed before me, and I can't turn my head away.
attributes.name: Clément

attributes.content: Why do barriers never cease to be? Is mankind doomed never to understand one another?
attributes.name: Clément

attributes.content: The tiniest chaos is enough to shatter the order. The moment confusion envelops, people begin to hurt one another...
attributes.name: Clément

attributes.content: Enough... I've put up with it for long enough.
attributes.name: Clément

attributes.content: Clément staggers his way before the holy statue, scorched in the fire.
No second lucky flower is there. Only an old wooden tray, holding a few slices of driest bread.
A staff of life somewhat strange in scent. Into his mouth it goes, and he chews.
It is a faint brininess, with a flavor as astringent as the tides.
*cough*, *cough* *cough*—Disgusting...
attributes.name: Clément

attributes.content: Clément, put down that object.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Put it down? No...
attributes.name: Clément

attributes.content: *cough* *cough*...
attributes.name: Clément

attributes.content: Last night, I was intending to go to confession, but ended up overhearing the Abbot's plan...
attributes.name: Clément

attributes.content: It made me think—surely, at least Gerald and his people didn't need to take part? They were about to leave anyway, weren't they?
attributes.name: Clément

attributes.content: But why... did it all turn out this way?
attributes.name: Clément

attributes.content: I'll eat of this until it's gone.
attributes.name: Clément

attributes.content: You are not doing this to prolong your own life. Why are you still attempting to change?
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: I just want an answer.
attributes.name: Clément

attributes.content: I want to know... if there's any being in this forsaken world that can save us.
attributes.name: Clément

attributes.content: Federico knows—he must stop the man before him, right now.
But in fact, he stands there, rooted in place.
Just a few steps outside, Arturia begins to bow her cello, strings cutting through quietus's curtain. The sentiments within, Federico does not grasp, and never tries to grasp.
But for the very first time, the executor cannot help his own actions.
He begins to lose his understanding of himself.

attributes.text: Why did he not act the very moment he saw the other party?
Why, despite this feeble man consuming a thing that turns people to monsters, has nothing happened at all?

attributes.content: The song rises, key wrested up by one tone.
Between notes, the silence that disperses seems a mocking joke.
*cough*, *cough* *cough*...
attributes.name: Clément

attributes.content: Ah... is this—blood?
attributes.name: Clément

attributes.content: So what—this is it? What's the—*cough* *cough*—what's the point—without...?
attributes.name: Clément

attributes.content: Respiratory rate quickening. It is possible that the blunt force trauma has caused bleeding in your lower respiratory tract or lungs. If steps are not taken, it may lead to suffocation.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: You require prompt medical treatment. Until then, I will perform first aid on you.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: No—*cough* *cough*—I...
attributes.name: Clément

attributes.content: Clément covers his mouth with his hands, and tries to stifle the sound of his coughing as hard as he can.
But still the blood spills forth from his palms, with a discomforting viscosity, dripping down along the creases in his fingers.
He staggers backwards, and tumbles to the ground before the statue.
The graven image he burned almost seems now to accept him once more, murderer bereft of strength that he is. Its broken arms fall to either side, as if in gentle embrace.
Clément feels a wave of peculiar warmth.
Hah... hahah...
attributes.name: Clément

attributes.content: Look at me, aren't I entirely alright...?
attributes.name: Clément

attributes.content: So even this turned out to be false. The Abbot was made a fool of. There's no God out there...
attributes.name: Clément

attributes.content: *cough*...
attributes.name: Clément

attributes.content: What you ate originates from some kind of oceanic detritus. It is exceedingly probable to have induced mutation on the physiological level, but it has never had anything to do with the God you speak of.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Hah... ridiculous...
attributes.name: Clément

attributes.content: You are in terrible condition.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: If you continue to worsen at your present rate, you will enter shock, and the risk of death will be enormous.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Really? That's just... not bad...
attributes.name: Clément

attributes.content: If you wish to leave any last will or testament, I am able to serve as your executor nominate.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Will...?
attributes.name: Clément

attributes.content: I don't have anything to leave...
attributes.name: Clément

attributes.content: Lateran... Our Paradise is a lie. Your faith is hollow.
attributes.name: Clément

attributes.content: Any friendship, faith, hope, future... it's all gone. No one can really be saved...
attributes.name: Clément

attributes.content: No one... no one can truly find redemption...
attributes.name: Clément

attributes.content: Is this a sort of choice? Is this some kind of happy ending?
The executor stands there, and moves no further forward.
Beyond the touch of anything or anyone, all his tribulations gradually fade away.
The weary gardener finally closes his eyes.
Still the lingering sound echoes, still I can feel it... A shake from the strings to my fingertips in the final moment, a last note so sharp it could tear skin.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Yet at the outset, that melody was calm as a babbling brook.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Someone otherwise so ordinary used his own life to prove one thing—that there is no such thing as a Savior. His unyielding mind triumphed over his own changing flesh.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Such beautiful music... This is the spirit of Mankind, tenacious and free, of a timbre those lamentable sea creatures could never know.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: This song will bring his story to all.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: They will understand his feelings, exalt his determination, and sing praise of his courage.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Clément Dubois will be remembered forevermore.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: —Wouldn't you say so, Federico?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: I was expecting you'd stay there a while longer. After all, you seemed to care greatly about the man who died... You even thought his affairs were higher priority than capturing me.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Federico, have you learned compassion? Or are you still as you were, unable to discern the emotions others feel, estranged from the crowd?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Fugitive Arturia, your Originium Arts have once again induced the death of another. I cannot ignore the greatest threat within my firing range.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Per the laws of Laterano, your sentence will be extended again.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: It was his will to seek death. Even had I not performed, he would still take this path.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Time after time, I simply shed light on the scars across these poor people's hearts, and what do bystanders do but turn and look away?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Are you stung by his experiences, just as others are?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Federico, you still can't make sense of uncontrollable urges even now, can you? Just as the abbot persists along his path of thorns...
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: ...Just as I cannot help but want to perform the emotions of others.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: I certainly cannot make sense of them.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Whether I do or not, it has no impact on my implementation of the law.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: But I proceeded to the sacrarium so that Clément would earn his rightful treatment.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: He was not worthy of death.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: —Oh?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: You wanted to save a man who intended to destroy himself.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Haven't you realized? That's not a notion logic would fit at all.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Clément said that once a flaw, imperfection, or wound manifests in something seemingly perfect, it is broken beyond repair.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: ...I will test the accuracy of this statement.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: You have become just a little more amusing, Federico... but only that little bit. Perhaps, come next we meet, that's when I'll be able to play your mind.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Sadly, it's time I wrap this trip up.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Excuse me, might you be Frau Arturia?
attributes.name: 'Gesandte des Kurfürsten'

attributes.content: I've been waiting for you.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: My apologies—we were the ones who extended an invitation to you as our guest, and yet I was late to arrive. Finding this place was an ordeal.
attributes.name: 'Gesandte des Kurfürsten'

attributes.content: Erm, have I perhaps come at a bad time?
attributes.name: 'Gesandte des Kurfürsten'

attributes.content: Federico!
attributes.name: Richele

attributes.content: Man oh man, I look at this scene and my brain is a pretzel.
attributes.name: Oren

attributes.content: Federico, how did it happen that you faced off with Arturia?
attributes.name: Oren

attributes.content: Good morning, Herren of Lateran.
attributes.name: 'Gesandte des Kurfürsten'

attributes.content: Good... morning, gnädige Frau.
attributes.name: Oren

attributes.content: (Federico, her coat of arms is from one of the Kurfürsten, the Principes Electores!)
attributes.name: Oren

attributes.content: You can't make a direct move against Arturia right now. Laterano-Leithanien ties would be at risk...
attributes.name: Oren

attributes.content: ...I refuse your suggestion.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Are you done talking it over?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Actually. How about, Federico, I give you one chance?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: If you want to point your gun at me, then this is where you want to aim...
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: The black-haired woman clasps the executor's tense gunhand in her own.
She presses the muzzle against her own forehead.
Just pull the trigger, and your bullet will pierce my skull. And from then on, I would never bother you again... Federico, do you want to do that?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Why don't you give it a try?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: I am required to arrest fugitives. If the situation does not necessitate, then shooting to kill is generally not advised.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: But your argument is extremely rational.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: What are you—?! Listen to me, this could be an INTERNATIONAL INCIDENT!
attributes.name: Oren

attributes.content: Hold on, Oren, I don't think things are that serious...
attributes.name: Richele

attributes.content: No, she will be fine. You do not understand this woman.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Heheh. I'm only playing a little game.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Frau Arturia, is this some kind of applied Arts?
attributes.name: 'Gesandte des Kurfürsten'

attributes.content: Even so, what you just did was far too dangerous.
attributes.name: 'Gesandte des Kurfürsten'

attributes.content: Thank you for your concern. I'll be cautious next time, should there be one.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Federico, think of this as a clue from me to you.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Have you ever felt like there's a performance that never ends, but you just can't hear it?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: That until its grandest, most wonderful passages, everyone is deaf to it?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Well, then. The music is over, and it's time I went on my way again.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Herrschaften of Laterano, auf Wiedersehen.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: If you'll excuse us.
attributes.name: 'Gesandte des Kurfürsten'

attributes.content: You're actually just gonna stand there and let them go?
attributes.name: Oren

attributes.content: I thought it'd take at least Richele and me at the same time to hold you back.
attributes.name: Oren

attributes.content: You are extremely noisy.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: What? Hey, Federico, where're you going?
attributes.name: Oren

attributes.content: He's headed for the area by the clock tower. If I remember right, that's where... the abbey's cemetery is?
attributes.name: Richele

attributes.content: Alright, no more gawking, all's well that ends well. Plus, we've still got things to do...
attributes.name: Richele

attributes.content: Senior Federico?
attributes.name: Erendel

attributes.content: Seniora Arturia...?
attributes.name: Estara

attributes.content: They're gone...
attributes.name: Estara

attributes.content: It's okay, let's go look somewhere else!
attributes.name: Erendel

attributes.content: Eep! Why's there a man lying down here?
attributes.name: Erendel

attributes.content: Shh, he's asleep. We shouldn't wake him up...
attributes.name: Estara

attributes.content: Oh!
attributes.name: Erendel

attributes.content: I know who this man is. He grows really pretty flowers! Same kind as Mamma always brings home to put in the vase!
attributes.name: Erendel

attributes.content: Mmm...
attributes.name: Estara

attributes.content: What are you doing, Sara? You know Mamma gave us that?
attributes.name: Erendel

attributes.content: But—he might catch a cold sleeping here...
attributes.name: Estara

attributes.content: Mamma said good kids learn to be app... precive.
attributes.name: Estara

attributes.content: You mean appreciative.
attributes.name: Erendel

attributes.content: Okay, we'll let him borrow it for a bit then!
attributes.name: Erendel

attributes.content: Mmm. Once he wakes up, I hope he'll keep growing heaps and heaps of pretty flowers.
attributes.name: Estara

attributes.content: Yeah, I'm sure of it!
attributes.name: Erendel
